pull.title: lint: Move assertion linter into lint runner
pull.body:
On failure, this makes the output more consistent with the other linters. Each failure will be marked with an '‚ö†Ô∏è ' emoji and explanation, making it easier to spot.

Also, add --line-number to the filesystem linter.

Also, add newlines after each failing check, to visually separate different failures from each other.

Can be reviewed with:
`--color-moved=dimmed-zebra --color-moved-ws=ignore-all-space`

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31435.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [hodlinator](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31435#pullrequestreview-2502719481), [davidgumberg](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31435#issuecomment-2560532713), [TheCharlatan](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31435#pullrequestreview-2530958970) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with üëé to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

Concept ACK faa0b09a4b6267399a214d7f5beaf4dfe9f3976c

Good call on integrating more of the comments from the old linter into the error messages.

Tested adding `assert()`/`CHECK_NONFATAL()`/`BOOST_ASSERT()` with expected results in *src/rpc/mining.cpp*.

Might as well avoid introducing the typo (see inline comment). That's the only light blocker for me.

---

nit: The whitespace changes are in the right direction, but I think they are still unclear with the current change.

### faa0b09a4b6267399a214d7f5beaf4dfe9f3976c

```
...
All checks passed!
src/rpc/mining.cpp:127:    BOOST_ASSERT(true);
src/rpc/mining.cpp:137:    BOOST_ASSERT(true);

^^^
BOOST_ASSERT must be replaced with Assert, BOOST_REQUIRE, or BOOST_CHECK to avoid an unessecary
include of the boost/assert.hpp dependency.
            
^---- ‚ö†Ô∏è Failure generated from lint check 'boost_assert'!
Check that boost assertions are not used


src/crc32c in HEAD currently refers to tree 454691a9b89ee8b9e1f71a48a7398edba49c3805
...
```

### With additional changes (7973da4cb9b7a6eaae7dfc1d3d681d9b75c5a226)

- No empty line separating errors and arrows ("^^^"). Keeping them together signals they are related.
- No empty line separating error message and linter failure line (not completely empty, it contains several spaces left over from Rust multi-line literal).
- Keep the linter description on the same line as the failure line, otherwise it looks like it's a description for the following step.
```
...
All checks passed!
src/rpc/mining.cpp:127:    BOOST_ASSERT(true);
src/rpc/mining.cpp:137:    BOOST_ASSERT(true);
^^^
BOOST_ASSERT must be replaced with Assert, BOOST_REQUIRE, or BOOST_CHECK to avoid an unessecary
include of the boost/assert.hpp dependency.
^---- ‚ö†Ô∏è Failure generated from lint check 'boost_assert' (Check that boost assertions are not used)!


src/crc32c in HEAD currently refers to tree 454691a9b89ee8b9e1f71a48a7398edba49c3805
...
```

author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1733475354 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1734079744 +0100

lint: Move assertion linter into lint runner

On failure, this makes the output more consistent with the other linter.
Each failure will be marked with an '‚ö†Ô∏è ' emoji and explanation, making
it easier to spot.

Also, add --line-number to the filesystem linter.

Also, add newlines after each failing check, to visually separate
different failures from each other.

Can be reviewed with:
"--color-moved=dimmed-zebra --color-moved-ws=ignore-all-space"

lint: Move assertion linter into lint runner

On failure, this makes the output more consistent with the other linter.
Each failure will be marked with an '‚ö†Ô∏è ' emoji and explanation, making
it easier to spot.

Also, add --line-number to the filesystem linter.

Also, add newlines after each failing check, to visually separate
different failures from each other.

Can be reviewed with:
"--color-moved=dimmed-zebra --color-moved-ws=ignore-all-space"

verification.payload:
tree 2e5451aff3c5278258091462ba959d15407b756a
parent fa9aacf614f6066ff3b5c02f0daaaeb0ebb93f33
author Hodlinator <172445034+hodlinator@users.noreply.github.com> 1734029239 +0100
committer Hodlinator <172445034+hodlinator@users.noreply.github.com> 1734107118 +0100

lint: output-only - Avoid repeated arrows, trim

- No empty line separating errors and arrows ("^^^"). Keeping them together signals they are related.
- No empty line separating error message and linter failure line (not completely empty, it contains several spaces left over from Rust multi-line literal).
- Keep the linter description on the same line as the failure line, otherwise it looks like it's a description for the following step.

events.message:
lint: output-only - Avoid repeated arrows, trim

- No empty line separating errors and arrows ("^^^"). Keeping them together signals they are related.
- No empty line separating error message and linter failure line (not completely empty, it contains several spaces left over from Rust multi-line literal).
- Keep the linter description on the same line as the failure line, otherwise it looks like it's a description for the following step.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -293,6 +304,62 @@ fs:: namespace, which has unsafe filesystem functions marked as deleted.
     }
 }
 
+fn lint_rpc_assert() -> LintResult {
+    let found = git()
+        .args([
+            "grep",
+            "--line-number",
+            "--extended-regexp",
+            r"\<(A|a)ss(ume|ert)\(",
+            "--",
+            "src/rpc/",
+            "src/wallet/rpc*",
+            ":(exclude)src/rpc/server.cpp",
+            // src/rpc/server.cpp is excluded from this check since it's mostly meta-code.
+        ])
+        .status()
+        .expect("command error")
+        .success();
+    if found {
+        Err(r#"
+^^^
+CHECK_NONFATAL(condition) or NONFATAL_UNREACHABLE should be used instead of assert for RPC code.
+
+Aborting the whole process is undesirable for RPC code. So nonfatal
+checks should be used over assert. See: src/util/check.h
+            "#
+        .to_string())
+    } else {
+        Ok(())
+    }
+}
+
+fn lint_boost_assert() -> LintResult {
+    let found = git()
+        .args([
+            "grep",
+            "--line-number",
+            "--extended-regexp",
+            r"BOOST_ASSERT\(",
+            "--",
+            "*.cpp",
+            "*.h",
+        ])
+        .status()
+        .expect("command error")
+        .success();
+    if found {
+        Err(r#"
+^^^
+BOOST_ASSERT must be replaced with Assert, BOOST_REQUIRE, or BOOST_CHECK to avoid an unessecary
comments.body:

comments.body: Glad you liked my commit! Unfortunately I'm currently operating on an unfamiliar keyboard, slipping my own "ƒ∫int"-typo into the commit message. :upside_down_face:  Feel free to replace with e8f0e6efaf555a7d17bdb118464bd572bd5f3933, or not.
